DataElement.preferredName: Disease Morphology ICD-O-3 Code Label Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The ICD-O-3 code and textual label which identifies the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) used to define the presence and nature of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

Concepts.definition: The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
A brief description given for purposes of identification; an identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCDI Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Using the values selected for component CDE 1 - 13606049 (ICD-O-3 Code) and component CDE 2 - 13606067 (ICD-O-3 Label Text):
1. Neither of the component CDE data values can be Unknown, Not Reported, or Source Data Not Available. 
2. Verify that CDE 1 - 13606049 (ICD-O-3 Code) value and CDE 2 -13606067 (ICD-O-3 Label Text) value are both referencing the same NCIt Concept Code.  If not, select values for CDE 1 - 13606049 (ICD-O-3 Code) and CDE 2 - 13606067 (ICD-O-3 Label Text) that reference the same concept code. 
3. Concatenate the values selected for CDE 1 - 13606049 (ICD-O-3 Code) and CDE 2 - 13606067 (ICD-O-3 Label Text) using the pipe "|" character, with a single space before and after the "|", to create the data value stored in the repository.
4. Example: 8822/1 | Abdominal fibromatosis
